pr_title: Support schema evolution for consuming segments

timeline.message: Support schema evolution for consuming segments
Support schema evolution for consuming segments
Support schema evolution for consuming segments
Support schema evolution for consuming segments
Support schema evolution for consuming segments

timeline.bodyText: We have two APIs, one named getColumnNames() and the other named getPhysicalColumnNames().  select * should decide which one to use? Do we need a third one? Why can't getPhysicalColumnNames API return the right set of columns from the consuming segment?
timeline.author: mcvsubbu
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -57,6 +58,13 @@
    */
   Set<String> getPhysicalColumnNames();
 
+  /**
+   * Returns all columns for the "select *" query
+   *
+   * @return Set of column names
+   */
+  Set<String> getColumnNamesForSelectStar();

replies.bodyText:
For the consuming segment, select * should return physical columns + newly added columns. Since the newly added columns are provided by the virtual column provider, I feel it a bit weird to include them in getPhysicalColumnNames method.
Basically the columns are

physical column
virtual column
2.1 built-in virtual columns (docId, segmentName, hostName)
2.2 newly added columns in the consuming segment

getColumnNames should return 1+2.1+2.2
getPhysicalColumnNames should return 1
getColumnNamesForSelectStar should return 1+2.2
replies.author: haibow

replies.bodyText: Newly added columns should not be included in virtual column provider. You need a new provider for these columns.
replies.author: mcvsubbu

replies.bodyText: Why are we treating newly added columns as virtual?
replies.author: mcvsubbu

timeline.bodyText: Given that we dont have a member called _newSchema, why rename this? Can we keep it as _schema?
timeline.author: mcvsubbu

replies.bodyText: Would like to avoid any potential confusion. If a schema update happens on the consuming segment, segmentMetadata and schema are still the original ones, without including the newly added columns
replies.author: haibow

replies.bodyText: nit: this feels like leaking information about very specific behavior into the MutableSegmentImpl. Instead, in the addExtraColumns method, the Schema param can be renamed to "newSchema". Besides, you already have _newColumnsFieldSpecMap
replies.author: npawar

replies.bodyText: Thanks for the comment. Updated the diff accordingly.
replies.author: haibow

timeline.bodyText: Same here. Why rename?
timeline.author: mcvsubbu

replies.bodyText: same above, segmentMetadata is immutable, just to be super clear it does not reflect the newly added columns.
replies.author: haibow

replies.bodyText: I would prefer to leave the names as is, and rename the new fields as _columnsAddedDuringConsumption or something like that. We can wait for others to chime in before we rename stuff
replies.author: mcvsubbu

replies.bodyText: Sounds good. I have reverted the rename
replies.author: haibow

timeline.bodyText: Just call the reload API on the segment, and let the segment decide if it is to be reloaded (i.e. depending on the config), and also how it should do it.
timeline.author: mcvsubbu

replies.bodyText: Could you elaborate on what you mean? To me, this method is the implementation of reload API (i.e. "how it should do it"). The logics below indicate how immutable segments are reloaded. Here it's a bit different for consuming segments - we just compare the schema and update the newly added columns, without doing an actual segment reload/replace.
replies.author: haibow

replies.bodyText:
I would bypass the references to DefaultColumnAction class altogether. Since we have a handle to the mutable index, just call the addExtraColumns API with the new schema. Just make sure that API handles well if we call it multiple times, either with same set of columns or newer ones than the previous time.
Agreed with your observation that this is the reload API. It makes me think that reload API should be implemented as a part of the segment API, but that is a HUGE change, and I am not sure what else is involved there (and why it was done this way as a static method like ImmutableSegment.reload()).  So, let us not go into that.
replies.author: mcvsubbu

replies.bodyText: Removed defaultColumnActionMap from the signature. Multiple calls to the same consuming segment is covered. It will always compare the new schema with the original schema (when the segment started consuming), and add the new columns to the new columns map.
replies.author: haibow

timeline.bodyText: remove this. We already have _logger
timeline.author: mcvsubbu

timeline.bodyText: Let us think of a better name for this
timeline.author: mcvsubbu

replies.bodyText: I thought about using "singlevalue" to express "same", but there might be ambiguity since we already use single/multi-value in fieldtype. Any suggestions here?
replies.author: haibow

replies.bodyText: How about Default or Extra instead of Same?
replies.author: npawar

replies.bodyText: Default sounds good to me. I will make the change if there are no objections/other suggestions.
replies.author: haibow

replies.bodyText: Constant is another alternative
replies.author: mcvsubbu

replies.bodyText: Thanks for the suggestion. Renamed to Constant
replies.author: haibow

timeline.bodyText: LOGGER  can be configured to log the class name, line number, etc. so we should not be logging class name
timeline.author: mcvsubbu

replies.bodyText: I'm trying to log the class name for each SegmentPruner class being called, not the main SegmentPrunerService class
replies.author: haibow

timeline.bodyText: no other changes here? why touch this file?
timeline.author: mcvsubbu

replies.bodyText: The file is auto formatted - had the wrong import order (after spi refactor). I guess I happened to format it when reading it
replies.author: haibow

replies.bodyText: you can undo your checkout (or, checkout from master and re-populate it)
replies.author: mcvsubbu

replies.bodyText: Since the import order should be fixed and has been fixed, I would like to keep the change as is. Will avoid such changes in the future.
replies.author: haibow

timeline.bodyText: Should be info log
timeline.author: mcvsubbu

timeline.bodyText: I think we should remove the DefaultColumnAction here. We know that there is only one thing we can do -- add columns with a default value. The only argument needed here is newSchema
timeline.author: mcvsubbu

replies.bodyText: Done
replies.author: haibow

timeline.bodyText:
We should have a different column provider here that should be optimized better than the virtual column provider. The new column provider should not be built every time, but should stay in memory once built. What  may be updated is the number of rows. That will minimize additional allocation during query processing.
Add a new column provider factory (say, ConstantValueColumnProviderFactory) that has a map from the col name to the provider. The map is built lazily as columns are added to the query.
timeline.author: mcvsubbu

replies.author: mcvsubbu

replies.bodyText: I don't see a strong reason to create another column provider factory just for this. I have updated the MutableSegmentImpl to cache the provider, and only initialize the provider or update row count when needed. This optimization will help other virtual columns ($segmentName and $hostName) too.
replies.author: haibow

timeline.bodyText: Not sure why DefaultColumnAction is needed here. We can just iterate through the schema and add a newly added column's FieldSpec if it is not there already. The FieldSpec can have the null value. There is no question of handling incompatible schema evolution at that point.
timeline.author: mcvsubbu

timeline.bodyText: We need to do this only if the newly added column is a virtual column, right?
timeline.author: mcvsubbu

timeline.bodyText: please update the comment, not always construct virtual column provider, but dependng on the new column type -- whether virtual or physical column
timeline.author: mcvsubbu

replies.bodyText: updated
replies.author: haibow

timeline.bodyText: Should we be using PluginClassLoader here?
timeline.author: mcvsubbu

replies.bodyText: Didn't know this. updated
replies.author: haibow

timeline.bodyText: Can we do theese things inside the Column ProviderFFactory so that we dont need to cast here?
timeline.author: mcvsubbu

replies.bodyText: updated a bit. kept one casting for updateInvertedIndex, since now we would like to cache the provider
replies.author: haibow

replies.bodyText: Why cache it? We construct it afresh for each query in the offline case, this should not be worse than that, right?
replies.author: mcvsubbu

timeline.bodyText: we can just get physical column names, right? Are we trying to say that virtual columns that do not start with dollar sign are ok?
timeline.author: mcvsubbu

replies.bodyText: right. updated
replies.author: haibow

timeline.bodyText: Since column context already contains the number of rows, we can call update inverted index right here
timeline.author: mcvsubbu

replies.bodyText: Not sure what you mean here. This is inside constructor, right? The current idea is to cache the provider when applicable and avoid rebuilding everything
replies.author: haibow

replies.bodyText: Hmm... ok, we rebuild this column provider everytime in the offline world, but yes. maybe caching can help (but, as you note, we need to update the inverted index, and later, any other auto-generated index if need be).
replies.author: mcvsubbu

timeline.bodyText: Not sure if we still need to modify this class. It should remain the same for the completed segments, right?
timeline.author: mcvsubbu
